Question: basics
Answer: basics

Question: Describe any two new features of HTML5.
Answer: HTML 5 comes up with many new features including video/audio elements for media playback and better support for local offline storage.

Question: What does a <hgroup> tag do?
Answer: It is used for heading sections. Header tags used are from <h1> to <h6>. The largest is the main heading of the section, and the others are sub-headings.

Question: Which video formats are used for the video element?
Answer: Ogg, MPEG4, WebM

Question: How can we embed video in HTML5?
Answer: <video src="movie.ogg" controls="controls"></video>

Question: Which video format is supported by IE?
Answer: IE supports MPEG4 and WebM.

Question: Name the audio formats supported in HTML5.
Answer: Ogg Vorbis, MP3, WAV

Question: What will the following code do?<audio src="song.ogg" controls="controls"></audio>
Answer: It will play the audio file named song.ogg.

Question: How will you define canvas with reference to HTML5?
Answer: It is a rectangular area, where we can control every pixel.

Question: Give an example of adding canvas in HTML5?
Answer: <canvas id="myCanvas" width="200" height="100"></canvas>

Question: Which methods/approaches are available in HTML5 to store data?
Answer:
Local Storage persists

| Session Storage is lost on window close etc

Question: Write a code snippet in HTML or Javascript that can count how many times a user visited the page.
How can you test your browser's HTML5 compatibility?
Answer: Visiting http://html5test.com checks the browser's HTML5 compatibility and shows scores.

Question: semantic tags
Answer: semantic tags

Question: aside
Answer:
The tag defines some content aside from the content it is placed in. The aside content should be related to the surrounding content.

My family and I visited The Epcot center this summer.

Epcot Center

The Epcot Center is a theme park in Disney World, Florida.

Question: Details
Answer:
The tag specifies additional details that the user can view or hide on demand. The tag can be used to create an interactive widget that the user can open and close. Any sort of content can be put inside the tag. The content of a element should not be visible unless the open attribute is set.
Copyright 1999-2014.

- by Refsnes Data. All Rights Reserved.

All content and graphics on this web site are the property of the company Refsnes Data.

Note: The details tag is currently only supported in Opera, Chrome, and in Safari 6.

Question: figcaption
Answer: The tag defines a caption for a element. The element can be placed as the first or last child of the element.

Question: figure
Answer:
The  tag specifies self-contained content, like illustrations, diagrams, photos, code listings, etc.

While the content of the  element is related to the main flow, its position is independent of the main flow, and if removed it should not affect the flow of the document.

Question: article
Answer:
The  tag specifies independent, self-contained content.

An article should make sense on its own and it should be possible to distribute it independently from the rest of the site.

Potential sources for the  element:

Forum post
Blog post
News story
Comment

Question: footer
Answer:
A  element should contain information about its containing element.

A  element typically contains:

```
 authorship information
copyright information
contact information
sitemap
back to top links
related documents
You can have several  elements in one document.
```

Question: header
Answer:
The element represents a container for introductory content or a set of navigational links. A element typically contains: one or more heading elements (

-

) logo or icon authorship information You can have several elements in one document. Note: A tag cannot be placed within a ,
or another element.

Question: main
Answer:
The  tag specifies the main content of a document.

The content inside the  element should be unique to the document. It should not contain any content that is repeated across documents such as sidebars, navigation links, copyright information, site logos, and search forms.

Note: There must not be more than one  element in a document. The  element must NOT be a descendant of an , , , , or  element.

Question: mark
Answer:
The  tag defines marked text.

Use the  tag if you want to highlight parts of your text.

Question: nav
Answer:
The  tag defines a set of navigation links.

Notice that NOT all links of a document should be inside a  element. The  element is intended only for major block of navigation links.

Browsers, such as screen readers for disabled users, can use this element to determine whether to omit the initial rendering of this content.

Question: section
Answer: The  tag defines sections in a document, such as chapters, headers, footers, or any other sections of the document.

Question: summary
Answer: The  tag defines a visible heading for the  element. The heading can be clicked to view/hide the details.

Question: time
Answer:
The  tag defines a human-readable date/time.

This element can also be used to encode dates and times in a machine-readable way so that user agents can offer to add birthday reminders or scheduled events to the user's calendar, and search engines can produce smarter search results.

Question:
Address

| Not strictly html5
Answer:
The <address> tag defines the contact information for the author/owner of a document or an article.
If the <address> element is inside the <body> element, it represents contact information for the document.
If the <address> element is inside an <article> element, it represents contact information for that article.
The text in the <address> element usually renders in italic. Most browsers will add a line break before and after the address element.

Question:
Address

| Not strictly html5
Answer:
The <address> tag defines the contact information for the author/owner of a document or an article.
If the <address> element is inside the <body> element, it represents contact information for the document.
If the <address> element is inside an <article> element, it represents contact information for that article.
The text in the <address> element usually renders in italic. Most browsers will add a line break before and after the address element.

Question: attributes
Answer: attributes

Question: autofocus
Answer:
The autofocus attribute is a boolean attribute.

When present, it specifies that an <input> element should automatically get focus when the page loads.

Example

Let the "First name" input field automatically get focus when the page loads:

First name:<input type="text" name="fname" autofocus>

Question: form
Answer:
The form attribute specifies one or more forms an element belongs to. Tip: To refer to more than one form, use a space-separated list of form ids. Example An input field located outside the HTML form (but still a part of the form):
First name:
Last name:

Question: formaction
Answer:
The formaction attribute specifies the URL of a file that will process the input control when the form is submitted. The formaction attribute overrides the action attribute of the
element. The formaction attribute is used with type="submit" and type="image". Example An HTML form with two submit buttons, with different actions: First name:
Last name:

Question: formenctype
Answer:
The formenctype attribute specifies how the form-data should be encoded when submitting it to the server (only for forms with method="post"). The formenctype attribute overrides the enctype attribute of the
element. The formenctype attribute is used with type="submit" and type="image". Example Send form-data that is default encoded (the first submit button), and encoded as "multipart/form-data" (the second submit button): First name:

Question: formmethod
Answer:
The formmethod attribute defines the HTTP method for sending form-data to the action URL. The formmethod attribute overrides the method attribute of the
element. The formmethod attribute can be used with type="submit" and type="image". Example The second submit button overrides the HTTP method of the form: First name:
Last name:

Question: autocomplete
Answer:
The autocomplete attribute specifies whether a form or input field should have autocomplete on or off. When autocomplete is on, the browser automatically complete values based on values that the user has entered before. Tip: It is possible to have autocomplete "on" for the form, and "off" for specific input fields, or vice versa. The autocomplete attribute works with
and the following types: text, search, url, tel, email, password, datepickers, range, and color. Example An HTML form with autocomplete on (and off for one input field): First name:
Last name:
E-mail:

Question: formnovalidate
Answer:
The novalidate attribute is a boolean attribute. When present, it specifies that the element should not be validated when submitted. The formnovalidate attribute overrides the novalidate attribute of the
element. The formnovalidate attribute can be used with type="submit". Example A form with two submit buttons (with and without validation): E-mail:

Question: formtarget
Answer:
The formtarget attribute specifies a name or a keyword that indicates where to display the response that is received after submitting the form. The formtarget attribute overrides the target attribute of the
element. The formtarget attribute can be used with type="submit" and type="image". Example A form with two submit buttons, with different target windows: First name:
Last name:

Question: height and width
Answer:
The height and width attributes specify the height and width of an <input> element.

The height and width attributes are only used with <input type="image">.

Note	Always specify the size of images. If the browser does not know the size, the page will flicker while images load.

Example

Define an image as the submit button, with height and width attributes:

<input type="image" src="img_submit.gif" alt="Submit" width="48" height="48">

Question: list
Answer:
The list attribute refers to a <datalist> element that contains pre-defined options for an <input> element.

Example

An <input> element with pre-defined values in a <datalist>:

<input list="browsers">

```
<datalist id="browsers">
  <option value="Internet Explorer">
  <option value="Firefox">
  <option value="Chrome">
  <option value="Opera">
  <option value="Safari">
</datalist>
```

Question: min and max
Answer:
The min and max attributes specify the minimum and maximum value for an <input> element.

The min and max attributes work with the following input types: number, range, date, datetime, datetime-local, month, time and week.

Example

<input> elements with min and max values:

Enter a date before 1980-01-01:
<input type="date" name="bday" max="1979-12-31">

Enter a date after 2000-01-01:
<input type="date" name="bday" min="2000-01-02">

Quantity (between 1 and 5):
<input type="number" name="quantity" min="1" max="5">

Question: multiple
Answer:
The multiple attribute is a boolean attribute.

When present, it specifies that the user is allowed to enter more than one value in the <input> element.

The multiple attribute works with the following input types: email, and file.

Example

A file upload field that accepts multiple values:

Select images: <input type="file" name="img" multiple>

Question: pattern
Answer:
The pattern attribute specifies a regular expression that the <input> element's value is checked against.

The pattern attribute works with the following input types: text, search, url, tel, email, and password.

Tip: Use the global title attribute to describe the pattern to help the user.
Tip: Learn more about regular expressions in our JavaScript tutorial.

Example

An input field that can contain only three letters (no numbers or special characters):

Country code: <input type="text" name="country_code" pattern="<A-Za-z>{3}" title="Three letter country code">

Question: placeholder
Answer:
The placeholder attribute specifies a hint that describes the expected value of an input field (a sample value or a short description of the format).

The hint is displayed in the input field before the user enters a value.

The placeholder attribute works with the following input types: text, search, url, tel, email, and password.

Example

An input field with a placeholder text:

<input type="text" name="fname" placeholder="First name">

Question: required
Answer:
The required attribute is a boolean attribute.

When present, it specifies that an input field must be filled out before submitting the form.

The required attribute works with the following input types: text, search, url, tel, email, password, date pickers, number, checkbox, radio, and file.

Example

A required input field:

Username: <input type="text" name="usrname" required>

Question: step
Answer:
The step attribute specifies the legal number intervals for an <input> element.

Example: if step="3", legal numbers could be -3, 0, 3, 6, etc.

Tip: The step attribute can be used together with the max and min attributes to create a range of legal values.

The step attribute works with the following input types: number, range, date, datetime, datetime-local, month, time and week.

Example

An input field with a specified legal number intervals:

<input type="number" name="points" step="3">

Question: input types

Question: Which input types are available in HTML5 forms?
Answer: email, url, number, range, Date pickers, search and color

Question: Which form input type will you use if you wish to take an email as input from the user?
Answer:
HTML5 form provides input field of type 'email' that can be used to take email address as input. The benefit is that email validation is done automatically.
e.g. <input type="email" name="email"/>

Question: Name any three types of date picker.
Answer:
a) month - selects month and year
b) week - selects week and year
c) time - selects time (hour and minute)

Question: Which HTML5 input type will allow you to select color?
Answer:
Color type can be used to get color input from the user. The user experience may vary depending upon the browser.
e.g. Select color: <input type="color" name="user_color" />

Question: What is the default video format for HTML5?
Answer: Ogg Theora is the default video format in HTML5.

Question: How do you differentiate HTML5 and Flash when playing videos?
Answer: HTML5 has built-in support for audio and video codecs whereas Flash plugin has to load them which makes it slower than HTML5.

Question: What does HTML5 use to access and store data?
Answer: HTML5 uses Javascript to access and store data.

Question: Is there any time limit for the localstorage object's data storage?
Answer: There is no time limit.

Question: When does the session storage data get deleted?
Answer: As soon as the user closes the browser, the session storage data is removed or deleted.

Question: What does datalist element do?
Answer: A list of options for an input field can be specified using datalist element.

Question: What HTML5 element provides a secure way to authenticate users?
Answer:
```
The keygen element.
e.g.
<form action="page.asp" method="get"> Username: <input type="text" name="location" /> Encryption: <keygen name="security" />
<input type="submit" />
</form>
```

Question: Define private and public keygen elements.
Answer: The keygen element is a key-pair generator and when a form is submitted, public key and private key are generated. Private key is used for encrypting the data and public key is used for decrypting the data.

Question: Where is the private key stored?
Answer: The private key is stored on the client and is never shared.

Question: Where is the public key stored?
Answer: The public key is stored on the server.

Question: What does a public key do?
Answer: The public key could be used to generate a client certificate to authenticate the user in the future.

Question: Which element is used for calculations and script output?
Answer:
```
The output element
e.g.
<input name="n1" type="number"> +
<input name="n2" type="number"> =
<output name="result"
onforminput="value=n1.valueAsNumber + n2.valueAsNumber"></output>
```

Question: Write the syntax of output element.
Answer: <output id="result" onforminput="resCalc()"></output>

Question: Is input attribute "form" supported in IE?
Answer: It is not supported in IE.

Question: Which web browsers support the input attribute "autofocus"?
Answer: Input attribute "autofocus" is supported by Firefox, Opera and Chrome.

Question: Does Opera support the input attribute "novalidate"?
Answer: Starting from version 11, Opera supports the input attribute "novalidate".

Question: What does autocomplete attribute do?
Answer: he autocomplete attribute specifies that the form or input field should have an autocomplete function.

Question: You have a form with multiple fields. You wish to automatically get focus on a field when a page gets loaded. Which field attribute will you use?
Answer:
The autofocus attribute will be used.
e.g. <form>
<input name="q" autofocus>
<input type="submit" value="Search"> </form>

Question: Does autofocus attribute work with all input types?
Answer: Yes, autofocus attribute works with all input types.

Question: What does form attribute do?
Answer: The form attribute is used to specify one or more forms.

Question: Give an example of form attribute.
Answer:
<form action="from1.asp" method="get" id="form1">

| First name:<input type="text" name="fname" /> <input type="submit" />

Question: What does form override attribute do?
Answer: Some of the attributes set for the form element can be overridden using override attribute.

Question: Explain the types of override attributes.
Answer:
a) formaction - overrides the form action attribute
b) formenctype - overrides the form enctype attribute
c) formmethod - overrides the form method attribute
d) formnovalidate - overrides the form novalidate attribute e) formtarget - overrides the form target attribute

Question: What is the main function of the override attribute types?
Answer: Override attribute types are helpful for creating different submit buttons.

Question: Which attributes can be used to specify the dimensions of an image used for the input type image?
Answer: The height and width attributes specify the height and width of the image used for the input type image.

Question: Give an example of input type image using width and height attributes.
Answer: <input type="image" src="img_submit.gif" width="24" height="24" />

Question: What does a list attribute do?
Answer:
The list attribute specifies a datalist for an input field.

<input list="browsers">

```
<datalist id="browsers">
  <option value="Internet Explorer">
  <option value="Firefox">
  <option value="Chrome">
  <option value="Opera">
  <option value="Safari">
</datalist>
```

Question: Name the input attribute’s types with which the attribute "list" works.
Answer: The list attribute works with the input types namely text, search, url, telephone, email, date pickers, number, range, and color.

Question: How can you specify minimum and maximum value for an input field?
Answer:
The min and max attributes of input field can be used to specify the minimum and maximum value for input field.
<form action="demo_form.asp">
  Enter a date before 1980-01-01:
  <input type="date" name="bday" max="1979-12-31">
  Enter a date after 2000-01-01:
  <input type="date" name="bday" min="2000-01-02">
  Quantity (between 1 and 5):
  <input type="number" name="quantity" min="1" max="5">
  <input type="submit">

</form>

Question: Which datatypes are compatible with input tag's min and max attributes?
Answer: input tag's min and max attributes work with numbers or dates.

Question: What does step attribute do?
Answer: The step attribute is used to specify legal number intervals for the input field.

Question: What will be the legal allowed values for the following?<input type="number" name="points" min="0" max="10" step="3" />
Give an example which shows a numeric field that accepts values between 0 and 10, with a step of 3.
Answer: Points: <input type="number" name="test" min="0" max="10" step="3" />

Question: Which attribute specifies that multiple values can be selected for an input field?
Answer: The multiple attribute

Question: With which input types does the multiple attribute work?
Answer: The multiple attribute works with the input type file and email. e.g. Select: <input type="file" name="img" multiple="multiple" />

Question: You have a form and you do not want any form validation over it. Which HTML5 attribute is to be used?
Answer: The novalidate attribute is used to submit not validated form data.

Question: Will you prefer HTML5 form validation over JavaScript form validation? Why?
Answer:
Yes. There are two reasons for this:

a) I have to write and maintain JavaScript form validation script.
b) If a user has disabled JavaScript on his web browser, then JavaScript form validation will be bypassed.

Question: Will HTM5 form validation work on a compatible web browser if scripting is disabled?
Answer: Yes. The browser will do RFC-compliant email validation on form submission.

Question: Given an example of a form that submits unvalidated data.
Answer:
<form action="demo_form.asp" novalidate="novalidate">
E-mail: <input type="email" name="user_email" />
<input type="submit" /> </form>

Question: What does a pattern attribute do?
Answer: The pattern attribute specifies a pattern used to validate an input field. A valid regular expression needs to be provided when using pattern attribute.

Question: Name the input attribute types with which the attribute "pattern" works.
Answer: The pattern attribute works with the types: text, search, url, telephone, email, and password.

Question: Give an example of pattern attribute.
Answer: In the following example, country code pattern is specified for validation. Country code: <input type="text" name="country_code" pattern="<A-z>{3}" title="Three letter country code" />

Question: What does a placeholder attribute do?
Answer: The placeholder attribute is used to provide a hint to the user about the expected value of an input field.

Question: Name the input attribute types with which the attribute "placeholder" works.
Answer: The placeholder attribute works with the following types: text, search, url, telephone, email, and password.

Question: What does a required attribute do?
Answer: A required attribute is a way to make a form field mandatory. User has to fill it in order to successfully submit the form.

Question: Name the input attribute types with which the attribute "required" works.
Answer: The required attribute works with the following types: text, search, url, telephone, email, password, date pickers, number, checkbox, radio, and file.

Question: Give an example to show the usage of required attribute.
Answer:
The following example makes the input field mandatory.

| You name: <input type="text" name="usr_name" required="required" />

Question: general events
Answer: general events

Question: What does the attribute “onmessage” do?
Answer: This attribute is generally applied to body tag and is introduced in HTML5. It allows a script to be executed when message is triggered.

Question: Define form event.
Answer: Form events are triggered by actions inside a HTML form.

Question: What does a form "onReset" event do?
Answer: onReset event runs a script when the user resets the form. It is not supported in HTML5.

Question: How many keyboard events exist in HTML5?
Answer: There are only three keyboard events in HTML5.

Question: Name the keyboard events.
Answer: onkeydown, onkeypress, onkeyup

Question: What does onkeyup event do?
Answer: It is a keyboard event and allows a script to be executed when a key is pressed.

Question: What does onkeypress event do?
Answer: It is a keyboard event and allows a script to be executed when a key is pressed and released.

Question: Which keyboard event will you use to execute a script when a key is released?
Answer: onkeyup

Question: How many mouse events are there in HTML5?
Answer: There are sixteen mouse events in HTML5.

Question: How do you differentiate between onmouseout and onmousewheel events?
Answer: Both are mouse events. onmouseout event allows a script to be executed when the mouse pointer moves out of an element whereas onmousewheel event allows a script to be executed when the mouse wheel is being rotated.

Question: Name the mouse events that are introduced in HTML5.
Answer: ondrag, ondragend, ondragenter, ondragleave, ondragover, ondragstart, ondrop, onmousewheel, onscroll

Question: Question
Answer: Answer

Question: media elements and events
Answer: media elements and events

Question: Name the media element attributes.
Answer: scr, preload, autoplay, mediagroup, loop, muted and controls are the media element attributes.

Question: When are the pending events and callbacks for media element discarded?
Answer: The pending events and callbacks for media element are discarded when the media element starts loading a new resource.

Question: When is a media element potentially playing?
Answer: A media element is said to be potentially playing when its paused attribute is false.

Question: How many tracklist objects of a media element are there?
Answer: There are two tracklist objects namely: multipletracklist object and exclusivetracklist object.

Question: What are media events?
Answer: Media events are those events which are triggered by media like videos, images and audio.

Question: What does media event oncanplay do?
Answer: This event allows the script to be executed when media can start play, but might have to stop for buffering.

Question: What does media event oncanplaythrough do?
Answer: This event allows the script to be executed when media can be played to the end, without stopping for buffering.

Question: What does media event onemptied do?
Answer: This event allows the script to be run when a media resource element suddenly becomes empty (network errors, errors on load etc.)

Question: What does media event onloadedmetadata do?
Answer: This event allows the script to be run when the duration and other media data of a media element is loaded.

Question: What does media event onstalled do?
Answer: This event allows a script to be executed when there is an error in fetching media data.

Question: What does media event onvolumechange do?
Answer: This event allows a script to be executed when media changes the volume, also when volume is set to "mute".

Question: What does media event onwaiting do?
Answer: This event allows a script to be executed when media has stopped playing, but is expected to resume.

Subject Marks

Question: Which attribute is used to specify language code for the content in an element?
Answer: The lang attribute

Question: Name the five events which apply to the <body> tag.

Question: Is <del> tag supported in all major browsers?
Answer: The <del> tag defines text that has been deleted from a document and it is supported in all major web browsers.

Question: What is the purpose of using <!DOCTYPE> in HTML5?
Answer: <!DOCTYPE> is an instruction to the web browser which informs the browser about the version of the markup language the page is written in.

Question: Give an example of DOCTYPE that you will use in your HTML page if you wish to refer to DTD that does not include presentational or deprecated elements.
Answer: <!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/strict.dtd">

Question: Is <!DOCTYPE> case sensitive?
Answer: NO, <!DOCTYPE> is not case sensitive.

Question: How to you define hyperlinks in HTML?
Answer: Hyperlinks are defined using the <a> tag, which is used to link from one page to another.

Question: How do you differentiate between HTML4's <a> tag and HTML5's <a> tag?
Answer:

Question: Write an HTML code snippet to insert an image in web page.
Name the two attributes of tag?

Question: What is the role of web worker in HTML5?
Answer:
The web worker allows JavaScript code to be set to run in a background process i.e. it helps in the development of multi-threaded applications.
The advantage of web workers is that intensive calculations can be processed in the background without adversely affecting the speed of the user interface.

Question: What do you know about geolocation API in HTML5?
Answer: It is used to support geographical based services by allowing a Web application to determine user's current geographical location.

Question: Which browsers do not have support for getitems()?
Answer:
Support for the Microdata API has just been removed from Webkit (Apple Safari). Support for the Microdata API was also removed from Blink (Google Chrome) a few months ago. This means that Apple Safari and Google Chrome will no longer support the Microdata API. Removal of the feature from a browser also shows us a likely future for Microdata, which is less and less support.

Any browser that supports the HTML5 microdata API, will have support for getItems() function on the global document object. If a browser doesn't support microdata, the getItems() function will be undefined.

Question: What is meant by HTML Serialization?

Question: Which MIME type does HTML use?

Question: How do we specify character encoding?
Answer:
We specify the encoding using HTTP Content-Type header.

<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html;charset=ISO-8859-8">

Question: What is the restriction on character coding?
Answer: The character encoding declaration must be serialized without the use of character references or character escapes of any kind.

Answer: The <sub> tag is used to define subscript text. Subscript text appears half a character below the baseline.

Question: Which property is used to specify the tab order of an element?

Question: In which browser min, max and step attributes work?
Answer: Opera 9.5 (and above) and Chrome 3.0 (and above) are the only browsers supporting min, max and step attributes.

Question: What are the valid values of canvas's globalalpha property?
Answer: Valid values of canvas's globalalpha property range from 0 and 1. Real values are allowed.

Question: In canvas's globalalpha property, what do 0 and 1 mean?
Answer: In canvas's globalalpha property 0 means no opacity and 1 means full opacity.

Question: How do you rotate a canvas and what is its unit of measurement?
Answer: To rotate the HTML5 Canvas, we use rotate() method. The rotate transformation is defined by an angle in radians.

Question: Using HTML5 canvas, how will you invert colors of an image?
Answer: We can iterate over all of the pixels in the image and invert the red, green, and blue components by subtracting each component from the max color value, 255.

Question: How can we create oscillation animation using HTML5 canvas?
Answer: This is possible using the KineticJS library. We need to use the equation for a simple harmonic oscillator in the updateStage() method of the Stage object.

Question: What is KineticJS in HTML5?
Answer: KineticJS is an HTML5 canvas library that extends the canvas API by providing support for animation and event handling.

Question: What is the purpose of body tag's attribute onoffline?
Answer: Execute a JavaScript function when the browser starts to work offline.

Question: Which elements can contain audio element?

Question: Which browser supports the Semantic <progress> functionality?

Question: How secure is the HTML5 storage database?
Answer: Within the browser, a web site can read/write in its own storage database i.e. other sites cannot access my sites database. HTML5 storage database is therefore secure.

Question: What does the tag <noframes> do?

Question: What is CSS? How does it work?
Answer: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is a style sheet language used to describe the presentation semantics (the look and formatting) of a document written in a markup language.

Question: Question
Answer: Answer

Question: cache manifest
Answer: cache manifest

Question: Which software storage feature is introduced in HTML5? What is its purpose?
Answer: The cache manifest is introduced in HTML5 which is a software storage feature that provides the ability to access a web application even without a network connection.

Question: What is the role of manifest file in cache manifest software storage feature?
Answer: A cache manifest file contains the sources that are required by a web application e.g. HTML pages, images, CSS, JS etc. On the very first user visit to a HTML site with cache manifest feature, his web browser will read the HTML5 manifest file, download the resources given and store them locally. In the absence of a network connection, his web browser will shift to the local copies and hence web application will be available to him even without a network connection.

Question: Which content type must be served by the cache manifest file?
Answer: text/cache-manifest

Question: Assume that you intend to use cache manifest feature and your web application exceeds on HTML page. Can all the pages share same manifest file?
Answer:
Yes. Each web page must have a manifest attribute that points to the cache manifest. e.g. <!DOCTYPE HTML>
<html manifest="/cache.manifest"> <body>
</body> </html>

Question: Write an HTML page that refers to a cache manifest file called mymanifest.manifest.
Answer:
```
<!DOCTYPE HTML>
<html manifest="mymanifest.manifest">
<head> <title>Hello</title>
<script src="myjs.js"></script>
<link rel="mystylesheet" href="test.css"> </head>
<body>
Hello World.
</body> </html>
```

Question: Should cache manifest files use absolute paths or absolute URLs?
Answer:
Cache manifests can also use absolute paths or even absolute URLs as shown below:
CACHE MANIFEST
/js/myjs.js /main/css/mycss.css http://test/images/img1.jpg

Question: How do you comment a line in cache manifest file?
Answer:
```
Hash character (#) is used to comment a single line in cache manifest file. e.g. CACHE MANIFEST
# this is a comment
```

Question: How are spaces and blank lines handled in cache manifest file?
Answer: Spaces and blank lines are ignored in cache manifest file.

Question: Name the cache manifest file headers.
Answer:
Cache manifest file consists of 3 headers namely: a) CACHE (to cache the resources)

b) NETWORK (not to cache the resources)
c) FALLBACK (to substitute online resources that cannot be cached / were not cached)

Question: Give an example of cache manifest file that uses manifest file headers.
Answer:
CACHE MANIFEST
FALLBACK:
/ /offlinepage.html NETWORK: /rates.html CACHE:
/css.css /js.js /image.png

Question:
```
Review the given cache manifest file. What does a single character (/) before ‘offlinepage.html’ refer to?
CACHE MANIFEST
FALLBACK:
/ /offlinepage.html NETWORK:
.....
```
Answer: The fallback section consists of a single line. i.e. / /offlinepage.html. The single character (/) before ‘offlinepage’ will match any URL pattern on your site. If the browser does not find the page in the appcache, the application will display the page /offlinepage.html.

Question: If you have a cache manifest file that has no section headers, how will the resources be treated?
Answer: All manifest files are divided into three parts: the “explicit” section, the “fallback” section, and the “online whitelist” section. Each section has a header, on its own line. If the manifest file doesn’t have any section headers, by default all the listed resources are in the “explicit” section, hence they will be downloaded and cached locally.

Question: If your browser has visited the web page (cache manifest enabled) before and recognizes the manifest file, will all the resources mentioned in the manifest be downloaded again?
Answer: If the manifest file has not changed, the downloading of resources will not occur.

Question: Question
Answer: Answer

Question: misc
Answer: misc

Question: Set a view port, what are the options?
Answer:
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0"/>

initial-scale=1.0 fits the viewport to the dimensions of the device (device-width and device-height values), which is a good idea because the size of the viewport fits the dimensions of the device regardless of its orientation.

width=device-width size the viewport to always corresponds to the (fixed value) width of the device, and thus is distorted in landscape orientation because que right value should be “device-height” not “device-width” in landscape (and it’s worse on iPhone5 whose device-height value is 568px, compared to its 320px device-width).

Therefore, I would rather recommend to use initial-scale alone, not associated width=device-width. Because the combination of the two is problematic, and moreover I think than even only width=device-width is problematic.
